Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower in added white outline and added red centres above two white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx to right (part of body with row of dots on underbelly, wing, neck and top of forelegs with red patches remaining); spiked rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93). Lemos describes a different sherd, but uses the correct photograph on pl. 66.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 259, no. 492, pl. 66)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0547) (phase 2)
